reviews.review_text: Space Trader is a very casual trader game. You mostly trade stuff and try to make as much profit as possible in a predifined timelimit. Trading side is like playing the old drug wars but it has some extra quests dialogs and events added.   On top of that there are bounties you can collect which take you to combat mode. If you catch the target, it's just more money. Additionally you will occationally get boarded by officials who try to make you pay taxes. If you are greedy, you will try and fight em, which will make the game even more interesting. Hard Stakes =) While the basic game is easy, the challenges can feel ridicilously hard giving something extra to the game.  If you are looking for something special you will definitely be disappointed, but I found it to be a fun and easy going game.
One of the coolest games I have ever played. For the price, I think it is the best game you can get.

Fun game and pretty cheap. The one problem I have with it is the chapter setup makes it seem rather limiting and you seem to lose all progress between the chapters. That said, its fun for what it is. The bounty missions are a nice change, explore mode (i.e. walking around) has some nice suprises in it and trading (the reason I played in the first place) works well and is what I expected. So buy, play, enjoy, just don't expect a deep several hundred hour trading game.

I personally enjoyed this game throughly. Has 'in' references to popular games, sucha as when one robot quotes the Slylandro Probes from Star Control 2. There are lots of things to do and it is fairly easy to beat. Sure, it is better suited to the casual gamer, but it is cheap and fun.

I had a lot of fun playing this game. It has a simple core mechanic: buy goods at your current location, pick another location to travel to and sell your goods there then buy new ones - repeat. It has a secondary mode as a FPS that can largely be ignored if you don't like it. As a fan of merchant/empire games and FPS games this was great for me. They even have a plot and side missions voiced by a hilariously small cast of actors obviously altering their voice to be different people.  Would have liked it to be longer and would definitely buy a sequel.

I bought it on the cheap for 50cents and it seems like a good deal sofar. Though because of this game I'm probably gonna start playing the X series again to get that visceral space combat feel back. I Like the fps part even though it is a bit barebones and small. Wish more games would mix the genres in a single game to give the complete feel of a proper space sim. FIGHT / EXPLORE / TRADE / BUILD / AND DO ALL IN SHIP OR ON FOOT FPS. This game only does a small part of that so the price fits the game.....anymore $$ and I couldn't really see getting it. Not a recommendation, but since steam only lets me say yes or no....I would say 'try' only if you like a barebone space trade/fps fight sim for a cheap price.
